successful novel tom brown school day told about tom at rugby school from age of to now tom be at oxford university for three year program of study in attends class lecture doe independent reading with tutor student in residence at oxford be said to be up have come up one who leaf be said to have gone down author weave picture of life at oxford university in s where be at time at oriel college where excelled in sport rather than academic university be made up of number of separate college student form friendship within develop loyalty to own college tom college st ambrose be fictional study program available to student be intended to prepare for legal ecclesiastical medical educational profession student who do poorly might be expected to enter diplomatic corp army navy though son of aristocracy might be thrust into minor church role to enter into business manufacturing engineering research science must require inheritance family connection latin be still taught because best literature available to be still ancient greek roman poet philosopher legal medical profession still used extensively though ecclesiastical educational field have largely abandoned tom find that there be social barrier between wealthy student student be there on equivalent of modern academic scholarship have to work a graduate student tutor to earn stipend there be sport scholarship at time though author hint vaguely at one point someday idea must be explored there be female student at time tom becomes involved with local barmaid barmaid being of different social class than tom relationship cause problem for of be important for modern reader to realize that such social distinction be very real inflexible in day working class referred to educated class a better meaning better educated entitled to better respect regardless of whether be earned deserved there be dormitory serve cafeteria a with modern college instead meal be served in dining hall by scout student get what be called room consisting of bedroom sitting room for study entertaining scout be kind of servant attached to one student small number of student run errand bring meal from kitchen take care of clothing bootblack called boot take care of footwear charwoman called char cleaned room if student wished to study without interruption must close oak door to room be called sporting oak signal not to disturb term eleven refers to cricket team prize men refers to student who win prize for scholarship hunting pink be red riding jacket hunter be horse especially suited to steeplechase fox hunting type riding boating club boat racing be popular sport of crew rowing sculling where college appoints crew of eight strong scull puller oarsman one small coxswain steersman to pilot long narrow boat called skiff shell coxswain call stroke be generally coach commander of crew unlike in canoe puller face backwards one nearest coxswain be called stroke oar because other oar watch match stroke racing take place on river run through oxford since because of oar river be too narrow for normal passing a in most other kind of racing race be sometimes with just two boat one ahead of other if prow of second boat touch stern of first boat second boat be considered winner advance in ranking if first boat row length of course without being bumped be considered winner maintains ranking sometimes winning crewman put little coxswain in boat parade through street of town at end of season honor of head of river belongs to boat have not be defeated be presumably fastest whereas slowest boat tail end charlie have be defeated by other college for description of boating on thames in nineteenth century see humorous travel log three men in boat to say nothing of dog by jerome k jerome written in also mention danger of lasher at sandford lock student be required to wear traditional student gown mortarboard cap to class professor wore floppy cap similar gown with indication of rank on sleeve doctor master batchelor garb date from middle age be now only seen at graduation day special university occasion gown have survived in church choir professor be also called don graduate assistant be called fellow servitor tuft student from nobility titled family be privileged set paid double fee be not required to do much of anything academically gentleman commoner be from untitled wealthy family also paid double fee few student from poorer social class be accepted if have good reference town gown refers to animosity between local permanent resident of town rowdy student occasionally descending into actual fist fight to be gated be to be confined to college to be rusticated be to be suspended from college wine be nineteenth century equivalent of student beer pizza party though seems to have be xlviii beginning of end xlix end l postscript tom brown at oxford by thomas hughes chapter introductory in michaelmas term after leaving school tom brown received summons from authority went up to matriculate at st ambrose college oxford presented at college one afternoon be examined by one of tutor who carried several other youth in like predicament up to senate house next morning here went through usual form of subscribing to article otherwise testifying loyalty to established order of thing without much thought perhaps in very good faith nevertheless having completed ceremony by paying fee hero hurried back home without making stay in oxford have often passed through so that city have not charm of novelty for be anxious to get home where a have never spent autumn away from school till now for first time in life be having fill of hunting shooting have left school in june did not go up to reside at oxford till end of following january seven good month during part of have indeed read for four hour so week with curate of parish residue have be exclusively devoted to cricket field sport now admirable a institution be beneficial a be influence on youth of britain be possible for youngster to get too much of so have fallen out with hero be better horseman shot total relaxation of healthy discipline of school regular hour regular work to have be used for so many year have certainly thrown back in other way whole man have not grown so that must not be surprised to find quite a boyish now that fall in with again marching down to st ambrose with porter wheeling luggage after on truck a when left at end of school career tom be in truth beginning to feel that be high time for to be getting to regular work again of sort landing place be famous thing be only enjoyable for time by mortal who deserves one at so be with feeling of unmixed pleasure that turned in at st ambrose gate inquired of porter what room have be allotted to within venerable wall while porter consulted list great college sundial over lodge have lately be renovated caught tom eye motto underneath pereunt et imputantur stood out proud of new gilding in bright afternoon sun of frosty january day motto be raising sundry thought in brain when porter came upon right place in list directed to end of journey staircase second quadrangle three pair back in new home will leave to install while endeavor to give reader notion of college chapter st ambrose college st ambrose college be moderate sized one there might have be seventy eighty undergraduate in residence when hero appeared there a freshman of unfortunately for college there be very large proportion of gentleman commoner enough in fact with other men whom drew round who lived pretty much a did to form largest leading set in college so college be decidedly fast chief characteristic of set be most reckless extravagance of kind london wine merchant furnished with liqueur at guinea bottle wine at five guinea dozen oxford london tailor vied with one in providing with unheard of quantity of most gorgeous clothing drove tandem in direction scattering ample allowance treated a pocket money about roadside inn oxford tavern with open hand going tick for everything must by possibility be booked cigar cost two guinea pound furniture be best must be bought pine apple forced fruit most rare preserve figured at wine party hunted rode steeple chase by day played billiards until gate closed then be ready for vingt et une unlimited loo hot drink in own room a long a anyone must be got to sit up play fast set then swamped gave tone to college at fact person be more astonished horrified than authority of st ambrose that of body in world must be fairly run away with by set of reckless loose young spendthrift be indeed melancholy unprecedented fact for body of fellow of st ambrose be a distinguished for learning morality respectability a in university foundation be not indeed actually open one oriel at time alone enjoyed distinction there be large number of open fellowship income of college be large living belonging to numerous so that best men from other college be constantly coming in of of former generation have be eminently successful in management of college st ambrose undergraduate at one time have carried off almost university prize filled class list while maintaining at same time highest character for manliness gentlemanly conduct have lasted long enough to establish fame of college great lord statesman have sent son there head master have struggled to get name of best pupil on book in short everyone who have son ward pupil whom wanted to push forward in world who be meant to cut figure take lead among men left stone unturned to get into st ambrose thought first very long step gained when have succeeded governing body of college be always on change in course of thing men of other idea came to rule at st ambrose shrewd men of world men of business of with good idea of making most of advantage who said go to why must not make public pay for great benefit confer on have not very best article in educational market to supply almost monopoly of will not get highest price for so by degree altered many thing in college in first place under auspex gentleman commoner increased multiplied in fact eldest son of baronet even squire be scarcely admitted on other footing a young gentleman paid double fee to college have great expectation of sort must not be expected that must be subject to quite same discipline a common run of men who must have to make own way in world so rule a to attendance at chapel lecture though nominally same for a for commoner be in practice relaxed in favour that might find thing suitable to person in position kitchen buttery be worked up to high state of perfection st ambrose from having be one of most reasonable have come to be about most expensive college in university change worked a promoter probably desired that must work college be full of rich men commanded in university sort of respect rich bring with old reputation though still strong out of door be beginning sadly to wane within university precinct fewer fewer of st ambrose men appeared in class list amongst prize men no longer led debate at union boat lost place after place on river eleven got beaten in match inaugurators of change have passed away in turn at last reaction have commenced fellow recently elected who be in residence at time write of be for most part men of great attainment of men who have taken very high honor elector naturally enough have chosen a most likely person to restore a tutor golden day of college have be careful in selection to confine to very quiet studious men such a be likely to remain up at oxford passing over men of more popular manner active spirit who must be sure to flit soon into world be of little more service to st ambrose be not men to get hold on fast set who be now in ascendant be not in nature of thing that must understand other in fact be hopelessly at war college be getting more more out of gear in consequence what must do however be doing under fostering care be growing up small set including most of scholar who be likely a far a be concerned to retrieve college character of school be too much like tutor men who did little else read wished for be likely to gain slightest influence on fast set best men amongst too be diligent reader of tract for time follower of able leader of high church party be then growing one led also to form such friendship a made amongst out college men of own way of thinking with high churchman rather than st ambrose men so lived very much to scarcely interfered with dominant party lastly there be boating set be beginning to revive in college partly from natural disgust of body of young englishman at finding distanced in exercise requiring strength pluck partly from fact that captain for time being be one of best oar in university boat also deservedly popular character be now in third year of residence have won pair oar race have pulled seven in great yearly match with cambridge by constant hard work have managed to carry st ambrose boat up to fifth place on river will be introduced to gentle reader when proper time come at present be only concerned with bird eye view of college that may feel more le at home in boating set be not so separate marked a reading set melting on one side into keeping up more le connexion with fast set also commanding sort of half allegiance from most of men who belonged to of other set minor division of of course there be many need not be particularized a above general classification will be enough for purpose of history hero on leaving school having bound solemnly to write doings thought to friend whom have left behind distance separation be to make difference whatever in friendship compact have be made on one of last evening at rugby be sitting together in six form room tom splicing handle of favourite cricket bat arthur reading volume of raleigh work doctor have lately be alluding to history of world have excited curiosity of active minded amongst pupil about great navigator statesman soldier author fine gentleman so raleigh work be seized on by various voracious young reader carried out of school library arthur be now deep in volume of miscellany curled up on corner of sofa presently tom heard something between groan protest looking up demanded explanation in answer to arthur in voice half furious half fearful read out be sure of thou shalt never find friend in thy young year whose condition quality will please thee after thou comest to more discretion judgment then thou givest be lost wherein thou shalt trust one will be discovered mean be raleigh yes here be in first letter to boating experiment fortunately in day there be outrigger even racing skiff be comparatively safe craft must now be characterized a tub while real tub in one of safest of prudent manager have embarked hero be of such build that required considerable ingenuity actually to upset if ordinary amount of bungling must have done be voyage must have terminated within hundred yard of cherwell while have be sitting quiet merely paddling almost letting stream carry down boat have trimmed well enough now taking long breath leaned forward dug scull into water pulling through with strength consequence of feat be that handle of scull came into violent collision in middle of boat knuckle of right hand be barked left scull unshipped head of skiff almost blown round by wind before must restore order on board never mind try again thought be after first sensation of disgust have passed off glance at shore showed that there be witness of course forgot one hand must go over other might have happened to anyone let see hand will keep uppermost left be weakest away went again keeping newly acquired fact painfully in mind so avoiding further collision amidships for four five stroke a in other science giving of undue prominence to one fact brings others inexorably on head of student to avenge neglect of so happened with tom in practical study of science of rowing that by thinking of hand forgot seat necessity of trimming properly whereupon old tub began to rock fearfully next moment missed water altogether with right scull subsided backwards not without struggle into bottom of boat while half stroke have pulled with left hand sent head well into bank tom picked up settled on bench again sadder wiser man a truth began to dawn upon that pulling especially sculling doe not like reading writing come by nature however addressed manfully to task savage indeed longing to drive hole in bottom of old tub a resolved a ever to get to sandford back before hall time perish in attempt shoved off bank warned by last mishap got out into mid stream there moderating ardor contenting with slow steady stroke be progressing satisfactorily beginning to recover temper when loud shout startled looking over shoulder at imminent risk of upset beheld fast sailor dart close hauled on wind almost aboard of utterly ignorant of what be right thing to do held on course passed close under bow of miniature cutter steersman having jammed helm hard down shaking in wind to prevent running over skiff solacing with pouring malediction on tom craft in man who have hold of sheet third who be lounging in bow heartily joined tom be out of ear shot before have collected vituperation enough to hurl back at be moreover already in difficult navigation of gut where notwithstanding effort again ran aground with exception arrived without other mishap at iffley where lay on scull with much satisfaction shouted lock lock lock keeper appeared to summons instead of opening gate seized long boat hook rushed towards hero calling upon to mind mill stream pull right hand scull notwithstanding warning tom be within ace of drifting past entrance to lock in case assuredly boat if not have never returned whole however lock keeper managed to catch stern of skiff with boat hook drag back into proper channel then opened lock gate for tom congratulated a entered lock that there be other boat going through with evil star be in ascendant thing animate inanimate seemed to be leagued together to humiliate a water began to fall rapidly lost hold of chain tub instantly drifted across lock be in imminent danger of sticking breaking back when lock keeper again came to rescue with boat hook guessing state of case did not quit until have safely shoved boat well out into pool below with exhortation to mind go outside of barge be coming up tom started on latter half of outward voyage with sort of look cato must have worn when elected losing side god went over to winning one previous struggle have not be thrown away managed to keep right side of barge turn corner without going around zigzag down kennington reach slowly indeed with much labor at rate safely rejoicing in feat stopped at island recreated with glass of beer looking now hopefully towards sandford lay within easy distance now upwards again along reach have just overcome solacing with remembrance of dictum have heard from great authority that be always easier to steer up stream than down from argued that worst part of trial trip be now over presently saw skiff turn corner at top of kennington reach resolving in mind to get to sandford before new comer paid for beer betook again to tub got pretty well off island shutting out unconscious rival from view worked away at first under pleasing delusion that be holding own be soon undeceived for in monstrously short time pursuing skiff showed around corner bore down on never relaxed effort must not help watching enemy a came up with hand over hand envying perfect ease with seemed to be pulling long steady stroke precision with steered scarcely ever casting look over shoulder be hugging berkshire side a other skiff passed thought heard sculler say something about keeping out minding small lasher noise of water own desperate effort prevented heeding indeed hearing warning plainly in minute however heard plainly enough most energetic shout behind turning head over right shoulder saw man who have just passed backing skiff rapidly up stream towards next moment felt bow of boat whirl round old tub grounded for moment then turning over on side shot out on to planking of steep descent into small lasher grasped at board be too slippery to hold rush of water be too strong for rolling over over like piece of driftwood plunged into pool below after first moment of astonishment fright be over tom left to stream holding breath hard paddling gently with hand feeling sure that if must only hold on must come to surface sooner later accordingly happened after somewhat lengthy submersion first impulse on rising to surface after catching breath be to strike out for shore in act of doing so caught sight of other skiff coming stern foremost down decent after trod water drew in breath to watch down came a straight a arrow into tumult below sculler sitting upright holding scull steadily in water for moment seemed to be going under righted glided swiftly into still water then sculler cast hasty anxious glance around till eye rested on hero half drowned head oh there be said looking much relieved right hope not hurt eh thankee all right believe answered tom what will do swim ashore will look after boat so tom took advice swam ashore there stood dripping watching other a righted old tub be floating quietly bottom upwards little worse for mishap doubt if boat can wish earnestly desiring in wooden mind to be allowed to go quietly to piece then there sooner to be rescued than be again entrusted to guidance of freshman tub having be brought to bank stranger started again collected scull bottom board be floating about here there in pool also succeeded in making salvage of tom coat pocket of held watch purse cigar case brought to bank delivering over inquired whether there be anything else to look after thank nothing cap never mind be luck enough not to have lost coat said tom holding up dripping garment to let water run out of arm pocket hole then wringing a well a must at rate thought need be afraid of looking too new more stranger put off again made one more round searching for cap anything else might have overlooked without success while be doing so tom have time to look well over see what sort of man have come to rescue hardly knew at time full extent of obligation at least if sort of obligation be to be reckoned not so much by service actually rendered a by risk encountered to be able to render there be probably not three men in university who must have dared to shoot lasher in skiff in then state for be in time really dangerous place tom have extraordinary escape for a miller st ambrose coxswain remarked on hearing story one who be born to be hung must have rolled down without knocking head against something hard going down like lead when got to bottom be very well satisfied with inspection other man be evidently year two older than figure be more set have stronger whisker than be generally grown at twenty be somewhere about five foot ten in height very deep chested with long powerful arm hand there be denying however at first glance be ugly man be marked with small pox have large feature high cheekbone deeply set eye very long chin have got trick many underhung men have of compressing upper lip nevertheless there be that in face hit tom fancy made anxious to know rescuer better have instinct good be to be gotten out of so be very glad when search be ended stranger came to bank shipped scull jumped out with painter of skiff in hand proceeded to fasten to old stump while remarked be afraid cap lost doe matter least thank for coming to help be very kind indeed more than expected say that one oxford man will never save from drowning unless have be introduced know replied other be sure be not hurt yes quite said tom foiled in what considered artful plan to get stranger to introduce then be very well out of said other looking at steep descent into lasher rolling bank carried across launched again tub gave much more trouble for be quite full of water very heavy after twenty minute so of hard work during mutual respect of labourer for strength willingness of other be much increased also lay in main stream leaking considerably otherwise not much worse for adventure now what do mean to do said stranger think can pull home in one doe know how much may be of same book of course be more satisfactory to one own self love to make everyone who come to one to learn feel that be fool wise men if object be to teach well usefully what know there can not be on ample common chapter iii breakfast at drysdale man in st ambrose college gave such breakfast a drysdale not great heavy spread for thirty forty came once twice term when everything be supplied out of college kitchen have to ask leave of dean before must have at in ponderous feast most hum drum of undergraduate kind might rival most artistic if must only pay battle bill get credit with cook with dish of broiled ham something of sort with marmalade bitter ale to finish with drysdale be not ordinary man a felt in moment when went to breakfast with for first time staircase on lived be followed joe out of room when worthy disappeared drysdale only laughed when found out went down to yard afternoon to see match between london dog own pet how in world be youngster with unlimited must sow wild oat oxford seems place especially set apart by providence for operation in wild range of accepted british maxim there be none take for in more thoroughly abominable than one a to sowing of wild oat look at on what side will can make nothing devil maxim of what man be young old middle aged sow that nothing else will reap one only thing to do with wild oat be to put carefully into hottest part of fire get burnt to dust seed of if sow matter in what ground up will come with long tough root like couch grass luxuriant stalk leaf a sure a there be sun in heaven crop turn one heart ground sweet again by dying day boy will be boy be not much better have true side to encouragement to sowing of wild oat be simply devilish for mean that young man be to give way to temptation follow lust of age what be to do with wild oat of manhood old age with ambition over reaching false weight hardness suspicion avarice if wild oat of youth be to be sown not burnt what possible distinction can be drawn between if may sow one why not other to get back to story tom went away from drysdale room night after have sorted tackle be to accompany fishing expedition to satisfaction in disturbed mean on pretense to allow to connect with however much may be taken with off hand hail brother well met manner dress may easily lead careless observer to take counterfeit for true article must call person in question muscleman a distinguished from muscular christian only point in common between two being that hold to be good thing to have strong well exercised body ready to be put at shortest notice to work of body be capable to do well here likeness end for muscle man seems to have belief whatever a to purpose for body have be given except hazy idea that be to go up down world with belaboring men captivating woman for benefit pleasure at once servant fomentor of fierce brutal passion seems to think necessity rather fine thing than otherwise to indulge obey whereas so far a know least of muscular christian have hold of old chivalrous christian belief that man body be given to be trained brought into subjection then used for protection of weak advancement of righteous cause subduing of earth god have given to child of men doe not hold that mere strength activity be in worthy of respect worship that one man be bit better than because can knock down carry bigger sack of potato than for mere power whether of body intellect have hope believe reverence whatever though coeteris paribus must probably a matter of taste prefer man who can lift hundred weight round head with little finger to man who can construct string of perfect sorites expound doctrine of contradictory inconceivables above remark occur a hero be marching innocently down towards first town gown row must scarcely like to see in middle of without protesting that be mistake know that other youngster of kidney will have fit of fighting desiring to fight with poorer brother just a child have measles shorter fit better for patient for like measles be great mistake most unsatisfactory complaint if can escape altogether so much better instead of treating fit a disease muscleman professor be wont to represent a state of health to let disciple run about in middle age with measles on a strong a ever now although hero have measles on at particular time passage of arm be about shortly to describe led to result of importance in history can not therefore be passed over yet wish at same time to disclaim in sponsorial individual character sympathy with town gown row with other class row quarrel of sort kind whether waged with sword pen tongue fist otherwise also to say that in such row so far a have seen read from time when roman pleb marched out to mon sacer down to when english chartist met on kennington common upper class be most to blame may be that be not aggressor on given occasion very possibly may carry on actual fighting with more fairness though be by mean true a rule nevertheless state of feeling make such thing possible especially in england where men in general be only too ready to be led taught by superior in rank may be fairly laid at door ever in case of strike just now will of course be at once thrown in teeth say fearlessly let man take trouble to study question honestly will come to conviction that combination of men for purpose of influencing labor market whether in much unjustly abused trade society in other form have be defensive organization that master might a body over over again have taken sting out of if have acted fairly a many individual amongst have done whether may not be too late now be tremendous question for england one time only can decide when drysdale tom at last found caravan be just getting dark something of crowd behave yourselves rejoined outraged female keeper giving up jackal a bad job pointing with pole proceeded little hanimal in upper cage be hopossom of north america misguided offspring of raccoon have put off feeding in order to suit must let keeper feed beast quietly threat of police be received with shout of defiance by of men though greater part seemed of opinion that matter be getting serious proposal of feeding be however welcomed by comparative quiet ensued for ten minute while basket of joint bread stale fish potato be brought in content distributed to famished occupant of cage in interval of peace showman keeper on hint from master again began round spirit of mischief be abroad only needed to make break out again in two minute beast from lion to smallest monkey be struggling for supper with one more undergraduate elephant have torn gown off donovan back having only just missed arm manager in confusion worthy of tower of babel sent off keeper for city police with whom must not live much without getting uncomfortably aware of dragon also have to slay what wonder apart altogether from difference in social position one man be ever becoming more more popular between only friend who must have have courage honesty to tell truth about new pursuit meantime hardy be much pained at change in friend saw quickly enough often thought over with sigh a sat at solitary tea set down to own dullness to number of new friend such sociable fellow a tom be sure to make who of course must take up more more of time if felt little jealousy now then put resolutely back struggling to think evil if there be to lay on own shoulder cribbage be most virtuous respectable game yet scarcely one must think possessing in sufficient attraction to keep young gentleman in twentieth year tied to board going through quaint calculation night after night of fifteen two fifteen four two for nob one for heel old lady of chough liked nothing so much a game of cribbage in evening board lay ready on little table by elbow in cozy bar sure stepping stone to good grace tom somehow became enthusiast in cribbage must always loiter behind companion for quiet game chatting pleasantly while old lady cut shuffled dirty pack striving keenly for nightly stake of sixpence seldom failed to lose laughingly wrangling with over last point in game decided transfer of two sixpence duly posted in snuffer tray beside cribbage board into waistcoat pocket bag until must take off spectacle to wipe sink back in chair exhausted with pleasing excitement odd taste a seemed too bystander might reasonably have thought when might have be employing time so much more pleasantly in very room for flitting in out of bar during game now then stooping over old lady shoulder to examine hand exchange knowing look with be lithe little figure of miss patty with oval race merry eye bright brown hair jaunty little cap with fresh blue ribbon of shade of st ambrose color however there be accounting for taste be fortunate that like apple onion may possibly be too miss patty did not feel neglected did not care about attention perhaps may not have be altogether unconscious that least motion word of hers be noticed even when game be at keenest at rate be clear enough that tom be on best term though always took aunt part vehemently in little dispute arose sometimes even came to rescue at end recaptured vanished sixpence out of wrongful grasp generally laid on moment old lady held out hand pronounced word game one know that size have little to do with strength one might have wondered that little hand must have be able to open finger so surely one by one though seemed to do must to keep shut after if really thought have right to money have always time to put in pocket at once instead of keeping clenched hand on table arguing about till have time to get up to succour of aunt chapter xiii first bump what be time smith half past three old fellow answered diogenes looking at watch never knew day go so slowly said tom be time to go down to boat not by two hour more old fellow ca take book something to keep quiet wo be fit for anything by six o'clock if go on worrying like so diogenes turned to flute blew away to appearance a composedly a if have be first week of term though if truth must be told be must to get up wander about in feverish distracted state for tom restlessness infected diogenes whole heart be in college boat so though have pulled dozen of race in time be almost a nervous a freshman on first day of race tom unconscious of secret discomposure of other threw into chair looked at with wonder envy flute went toot toot toot till must stand no longer so got up went to window leaning out looked up down street for minute in purposeless sort of fashion staring hard at everybody everything unconscious time that be doing so must not have be able in fact to answer diogenes word have not that worthy inquired of what have seen when presently drew in head returned to fidgety ramblings about room how hot sun be there be stiff breeze from south east hope will go down before evening yes wind will make very rough below gut mind feather high now at according to development of bump of conscientiousness obstinacy to keep to diet at strictly involved very respectable amount of physical endurance successor have found out unwisdom of a of other old chapter xvi storm rage hardy be early in chapel next morning be week for pricking in man who entered from early men who strolled in quietly while bell be still ringing to hurrying half dressed loiterer who crushed in a porter be closing door disturbed congregation in middle of confession gave turn a expressive phrase be turn only ended in disappointment put by list at last when door be fairly shut with sigh have half expected to see tom come into morning chapel with face from might have gathered hope that friend have taken right path tom did not come at hardy felt be bad sign did not meet till evening at river when boat went down for steady pull then hardy saw at once that be going wrong neither spoke to looked at other hardy expected one to remark nobody did after pull walked up tom a usual led way a if nothing have happened into chough hardy paused for moment then went in too stayed till rest of crew left tom deliberately stayed after hardy turned for moment a be leaving bar saw settling down in chair with air of defiance meant evidently for must have made most men angry be irritated for moment then be filled with roth for poor wrong headed youngster who be heaping up coal of fire for own head in momentary anger hardy said to well have done what can now must go own way thought be soon kicked in disgrace from noble well disciplined mind resolved that let cost what might in shape of loss of time trial of temper must leave stone unturned spare pain to deliver friend of yesterday from slough into be plunging how might best work for end occupied thought a walked towards college tom sat on at chough glorifying in thought now at rate have shown hardy that be to be dragooned into doing not doing anything have have bad time of day good angel have fought hard for victory self will be too strong for time when stayed behind rest be more out of bravado than from defined purpose of pursuing what tried to persuade be innocent flirtation when left house hour after be deeper in toil than ever dark cloud be gathering over heart from time be altered man altering a rapidly for worse in body a in mind hardy saw change in groaned over in secret miller quick eye detected bodily change after next race drew tom aside said why brown what be matter what have be about be breaking down hold on man there be only one more night never fear said tom proudly will last out in last race did work again though cost more than preceding one put together when got out of boat must scarcely walk see felt fierce kind of joy in own distress wished that there be more race to come miller a walked up arm in arm with captain took different view of subject well be all right see said captain be not boat length better than oriel over course after how be bumped if anything drew little on to night ay boat length must say answered miller be uncommonly glad be over brown be going to piece must stand race have man to put in place be odd too said captain put down a laster have trained well perhaps have overdone little however matter now so race be over that night great supper be held in st ambrose hall to be bidden came crew of boat from exeter upwards dean with many from eight to eleven fine old pointed window of st ambrose hall blazed with light chorus of song cheer followed short interval of silence speech made rang out over quadrangle made poor dean amble downwards ever faster downwards plunged light getting fainter ever fainter above head little good can come of dwelling on day left off pulling shunned old friend lived with very worst men knew in college who be ready enough to let share brutal orgy drysdale who be often present wondered at change saw plainly enough be sorry for in way be business of began to think that brown be good enough when nothing else must be have whenever there be sickness in place be untiring nurse at one time for nine month took office of postman walked daily nine mile through severe winter fatigue exposure have broken down health made old woman before time at last in lucky hour doctor came to hear of praiseworthy struggle gave rectory washing have made life comparatively easy one again during time poor neighbor have stood by a poor do stand by one helping in numberless small way so that have be able to realize great object of life keep harry at school till be nearly fourteen by time have learned that village pedagogue must teach have in fact become object of mingled pride jealousy to worthy man who have misgiving lest harry fame a scholar must eclipse own before many year be over mr winburn character be so good that sooner be son ready for place than place be ready for stepped at once into dignity of carter boy earnings when added to mother made comfortable enough of course be wrapped up in believed that there be such boy in parish indeed be nearer truth than most mother for soon grew into famous specimen of countryman tall lithe full of nervous strength not yet bowed down stiffened fond of reading such book a came in way spoke native english almost without accent be one twenty at time when story take up thoroughly skilled labourer best hedger ditcher in parish when blood be up chapter xviii englebourne village dame winburn be not long after son sat down together to breakfast in best sunday clothes in plain large white cap covered line of grey hair black stuff gown reaching to neck wrist small silk neckkerchief put on like shawl thin almost gaunt old woman whom year have not used tenderly who showed mark of usage resolute high couraged soul who have met hard time in face must meet again if need be spoke in broad berkshire be otherwise homely body self possessed without shade of real vulgarity in composition widow looked with anxiety at harry a took seat although something of rustic dandy of late have not be so careful in matter of dress a usual in consequence of reproach on sunday there be nothing to complain of black velveteen shooting coat cotton plush waistcoat brown corduroy knee breech gaiter sat on well gave world assurance of well to do man for few of englebourn labourer rose above smock frock fustian trouser wore blue bird eye handkerchief round neck shirt though coarse in texture be a white a sun best laundress in englebourn must manage to bleach there be nothing to find fault with in dress therefore still mother did not feel quite comfortable a took stealthy glance at harry be naturally reserved fellow did not make much conversation mother felt little embarrassed on particular morning be not therefore until dame winburn have finished first slice of bread butter have sipped greater part of second dish of tea out of saucer that broke silence minded thy business last night harry when wur up at rectory about washin be belief a thou'lt get t'other 'lotment next quarter day doctor spoke very kind about said a how heer a high character o ' thee young a thee bist a of be ' man in parish a how wur set on lettin ' lot to thaay a 'd do best by 'em only said a farmer went agin givin more acre to man a worked for doctor see like to go altogether agin vestry folk what business be o ' theirs said harry so long a get own work scriptur say a to will be given will have more abundant dame winburn spoke hesitatingly looked doubtfully at harry a person who have shot with strange gun know not what effect bolt may have harry be see doctor about now thou'rt like to get th'lotment thou'lt not go anyst harry looked out at open door without answering be quite true that in last autumn have be very anxious to get a large allotment a must into own hand that have be for ever up towards rectory perhaps not always on allotment business be naturally self reliant shrewd fellow felt that if must put hand on three four acre of land must soon make independent of farmer knew that at harvest time whenever there be pinch for good labourer must be glad enough to have while at other time with few acre of own must be own master must do much better for so have put name down first on doctor list taken largest lot must get worked so well that crop amongst others have be sort of village show last harvest time many of neighboring allotment stood out in sad contrast to of harry more energetic of peasantry lay by side of latter only half worked full of weed rent be never ready be worse than useless to let matter go on thus question arose what be to be done with neglected lot harry men like applied at once for eagerness to get have roused natural jealousy amongst farmer who began to foresee that new system might shortly leave with none worst labourer so vestry have pressed on doctor a dame winburn said not to let man have more than acre acre half well meaning easy going invalid old man must make up mind what to do so here be may again neglected lot be still in nominal occupation of idler doctor got rent be annoyed at partial failure of scheme have not indeed originated for have taken much credit to negligent now for to do more than clean lot of weed year farmer grumbled that be always understood that man must have more than one lot poor rector have led flock into miry place with vengeance people who can not make up mind breed trouble in other place besides country village however quiet out of way place may be there be always quasi public topic stand to rural englishman in place of treaty budget fancy cross grained old simon having pretty daughter oh katie look here who be figure of fun figure of fun be middle aged man of small stature very bandy legged dressed in blue coat brass button carrying great bass viol bigger than in rough baize cover came out of footpath into road just before on seeing touched hat to miss winter then fidgeted along with load jerked head in deprecatory manner away from a walked on with sort of look action favorite terrier us when master hold out lighted cigar to nose be village tailor constable also principal performer in church music obtained in englebourn in latter capacity have of late come into collision with miss winter for be of question divided parish great church music question from time immemorial at least ever since gallery at west end have be built village psalmody have be in hand of occupier of protestant structure in middle of front row sat musician three in number who played respectively bass viol fiddle clarionet on one side of be two three young woman who sang treble shrill ear piercing treble with strong nasal berkshire drawl in on other side of musician sat blacksmith wheelwright other tradesman of place tradesman mean in part of country what mean by artisan be naturally allied with laborer consorted with so far a church going be concerned formed sort of independent opposition sitting in gallery instead of in nave where farmer two three principal shopkeeper great landed commercial interest regularly sat slept where two publican occupied pew seldom made even pretence of worshipping rest of gallery be filled by able bodied male peasantry old worn out men generally sat below in free seat woman also few boy heart of latter be in gallery seat on back bench of be sign that have indued toga virilis be thenceforth free from maternal pastoral tutelage in matter of church going gallery thus constituted have gradually usurped psalmody a particular special portion of service left clerk school child aided by such of aristocracy below a cared to join to do response when singing time came reigned supreme slate on psalm be announced be hung out from before centre of gallery clerk leaving place under reading desk marched up there to give out took method of preserving constitutional connection with singing knowing otherwise must not have maintained rightful position of office in matter so matter have stood until shortly before time of story present curate however backed by miss winter have tried reform be quiet man with wife several child small mean have served in diocese ever since have be ordained in hum drum sort of way going where be sent for performing routine duty reasonably well without showing great aptitude for work have little interest have almost given up expecting promotion certainly have done nothing particular to merit there be one point on be always ready to go out of way take little trouble be good musician have formed choir at former curacy soon after arrival therefore in concert with miss winter have begun to train child in church music small organ have stood in passage in rectory for many year have be repaired appeared first at schoolroom at length under gallery of church be announced one week to party in possession that on next sunday constituted authority must take church music into own hand then arose strife end of have nearly be to send gallery off in body headed by offended bass viol to small red brick little bethel at other end of village fortunately curate have too much good sense to drive matter to extremity so alienate parish constable large part of flock though have not tact energy enough to bring round to own view so compromise be come to curate choir be allowed to chant psalm canticle have always be read before while gallery remained triumphant master of regular psalm reader will now understand why miss winter salutation to musical constable be not so cordial a be to other villager whom have come across previously indeed miss winter though acknowledged constable salutation did not seem inclined to encourage to accompany talk mind out although be going same way with instead of drawing out a be wont in such case went on talking to cousin little man walked out in road evidently in trouble of mind did not like to drop behind go ahead without further remark from miss winter yet must not screw up courage to point of opening conversation so ambled on alongside footpath on be walking showing discomfort by twist of neck few second perpetual shifting of bass viol hunching up of one shoulder conversation of young lady under circumstance be of course forced miss mary though infinitely delighted at meeting soon began to pity involuntary companion be full of sensitive instinct best sort of woman have to marvellous extent tell at once infallibly if one in company have even creased rose leaf next moral skin before have walked hundred yard be interceding for rebellious constable katie said softly in french do before house on lawn on warm day be one of daughter greatest trouble little choir of child sang admirably led by schoolmistress miss winter curate exchanged approving glance performed liveliest chant scarcely begun when there be stir down by door at west end people began to look round whisper presently man came softly up said something to clerk clerk jumped up whispered to curate who paused for one two very infirm old folk shut up pocketed sermon followed flock proved luckily to be only farmer grove chimney not house be on fire farmhouse be only two field from village congregation rushed across there harry winburn two three of most active young men boy leading a entered yard flame be rushing out of chimney moment thatch might take fire here be real danger ladder have just be raised against chimney while frightened farm girl carter boy held at bottom man be going up carrying bucket of water shook with weight top be slipping gradually along face of chimney in moment must rest against nothing harry companion saw danger at glance shouted to man to stand still till must get to ladder rushed towards with rush men can only make under strong excitement foremost of caught spoke with one hand before must steady top slipped clear of chimney ladder man bucket came heavily to ground then came scene of bewildering confusion a woman child trooped into yard who be be dead fire be catching thatch stable be on fire who did sort of cry sort of act except right one fortunately two three of men with head on shoulder soon organized line for handling bucket flue be stopped below harry winburn standing nearly at top of ladder be now safely planted be deluging thatch round chimney from bucket handed up to in few minute be able to pour water down chimney soon afterwards whole affair be at end farmer dinner be spoilt otherwise damage have be done except to clothes of foremost men only accident be that first fall from ladder man have be carried out of yard while fire be still burning so that be hardly known who be now in answer to inquiry proved to be old rector gardener head man who have seen fire sent news to church while went to spot with such result a have seen that master be out busy did not come to boat did not appear in hall so after hall when tom went back to own room a did at once instead of sauntering out of college going to wine party be quite out of to be intimate with tom at own special request attended captain departure took seat opposite to son at back of southampton coach to accompany few mile out of oxford for first mile captain be full of captain with large leather case in hand out of took two five pound note began pressing on son while tom tried to look a if did not know what be going on for time hardy steadily refused contention became animated be useless to pretend longer not to hear why jack be not too proud hope to take present from own father captain said at last dear father want money make very good allowance already now jack just listen to be reasonable know great many of friend have be very hospitable to must not return hospitality wish to do so for well father can do without money now jack said captain pushing forward note again insist on taking will pain very much if take so son took note at last looking a most men of age must if have just lost while father face be radiant a replaced pocket book in breast what be be not ill said quickly quite well aunt say did see then fact be have gone home chapter xxiii englebourn constable on afternoon of splendid day in early part of june four five day after sunday on morning service at englebourn be interrupted by fire at farmer grove david johnson tailor constable of parish be sitting at work in small erection half shed half summer house leaned against back of cottage not that david have not regular workshop with window looking into village street regular counter close under on passersby might see stitching from must gossip with easily a be wont although constable kept king peace made garment of kind for livelihood from curate frock down to ploughboy fustian be addicted for pleasure solace to keeping of bee constable bee inhabited row of hive in narrow strip of garden ran away at back of cottage strip of garden be bordered along whole of one side by rector premise now honest david loved gossip well considered part of duty a constable to be well up in event rumour happened arose within liberty loved bee better than gossip a be now in hourly expectation that must be swarming be working a have be said in summer house that might be at hand at critical moment rough table on be seated commanded view of hive big scissors shred of velveteen lay near on table also street door key old shovel of us will appear presently on knee lay black velveteen coat sunday garment of harry winburn to be fitting new sleeve in exertion at top of chimney in putting out fire harry have grievously damaged garment in question farmer have presented with five shilling on occasion sum be quite inadequate to purchase of new coat harry being too proud to call farmer attention to special damage have suffered in service have contented with bringing old coat to be new sleeved harry be favorite with constable on account of intelligence independence because of relation with farmer of englebourn on allotment question although by office representative of law order in parish david be man of people sympathized with peasantry more than with farmer have passed year of apprenticeship at reading where have picked up notion on political social question much ahead of englebourn worthy when returned to native village being wise man have kept new light in background consequently have succeeded in object of ambition have be appointed constable reason for seeking post be desire to prove that old joke a to manliness of tailor have application to case have established to satisfaction of neighborhood by resolute manner in called on performed duty now that character be made position secure be not so careful of betraying leaning have lost custom amongst farmer in consequence of job on be employed naturally turned thought to harry stitched away now weighing in mind whether must not go to farmer grove represent to that ought to give harry new coat now rejoicing over fact that rector have decided to let harry have acre of allotment land now speculating on attachment of favorite to gardener daughter whether must do thing to forward suit in pursuit of thought have forgotten about bee when suddenly great humming arose followed by rush through air like passing of express train recalled to jumped from table casting aside coat seizing key shovel hurried out into garden beating two together with might process in question known in country phrase a tanging be founded upon belief that bee will not settle unless under influence of peculiar music constable holding faithfully to popular belief rushed down garden tanging a though life depended upon in hope that soothing sound must induce swarm to settle at once on own apple tree be tanging superstition not people learned in bee ought to know never happened to meet one who have settled question be curious how such belief superstition fix in popular mind of countryside be held by wise simple alike david constable be most sensible open minded man of time class kemble akerman other learned anglo saxon scholar must have vainly explained to that tang be old word for to hold that object of tanging be not to lure bee with sweet music of key shovel to give notice to neighbour that have swarmed that owner of maternal hive mean to hold on to right to emigrant david must have listened to lecture with pity have retained unshaken belief in music in present case however tanging be of little avail for swarm after wheeling once twice in air disappeared from eye of constable over rector wall went on tanging violently for minute two then paused to consider what be to be done must get over wall into rector garden at once must go round ask leave to carry search into parsonage ground a man bee fancier be on point of following straight at once over wall fence constable be also strong within be not on best of term with old simon rector gardener late opposition to miss winter in matter of singing also came into mind so resolved that parish constable must lose caste by disregarding neighbour boundary be considering what to do next when heard footstep short cough on other side of wall recognized be there maester simon called out where upon walker on other side pulled up after second appeal answered shortly e'es hev'ee seed ought o bee thaay have bin riz gone off somweres athert wall e'es seen wer ' be 'em then aal amang wi ' ourn in lime aal amang wi'yourn evening asking to come round by cottage on way home harry promised to do walked back to village chapter xxiv school there be more characteristic spot in oxford than quadrangle of school doubtless in time when university held exercised privilege of infang thief outfang thief other such old world right there must have be place somewhere within liberty devoted to examination even more exciting than great go since alma mater have ceased to take cognizance of treason insurrection felony mayhem be here in fateful inexorable quadrangle building surround that exercise most potent spell over spirit of child suppose that man being tried for life must be more uncomfortable than undergraduate being examined for degree to be hung perhaps even to be pilloried must be worse than to be plucked after feeling in case must be essentially same only more intense in former institution can examine man in literis humanitoribus in humanity so called once year for two three day at time have nothing to complain of though have no longer power of hanging at once out of hand school quadrangle be for most part lonely place men pas through melancholy iron gate by quadrangle be entered on three side from broad street from ratcliff from new college lane when necessity lead way with alert step silently nursemaid child play about nobody life in only when examination be going on may see few hooded figure who walk a though conscious of power of academic life death wield good deal of shuddering undergraduate life flitting about place luckless youth in white tie band who be undergoing peine forte et dure with different degree of composure friend who be there to look after may go in watch torture if be so minded for viva voce school be open to public one such experiment will be enough for unless be very hard hearted sight of long table behind sit minos rhadamanthus co full robed stern of face soft of speech seizing victim in turn now letting run little way a cat doe mouse then drawing back with claw of wily question probing on side that turning inside out row of victim opposite pale flushed of anxious careless mien according to temperament one on rack a bend over allotted paper read from well thumbed book scarcely le to be pitied row behind of future victim sitting for school a be called ruthlessly brought hither by statute to watch suffering must hereafter undergo must fill friend of suffering humanity with thought too deep for tear through long day till four o'clock later torture last then last victim be dismissed men who be sitting for school fly way to college silently in search of relief to over wrought feeling probably also of beer undergraduate universal specific beadle close ruthless door for mysterious half hour on examiner outside in quadrangle collect by two three friend of victim waiting for reopening of door distribution of testamurs testamurs lady reader will be pleased to understand be certificate under hand of examiner that son brother husband perhaps have successfully undergone torture if husband oh go not yourselves send not son to wait for testamur of head of house for oxford have seldom seen sight over must more willingly draw veil with averted face than of youth rushing wildly dissolved in tear from school quadrangle shouting mamma papa plucked papa plucked examination be nearly over be to decide academical fate of of character paper work of candidate for honor have be going on for last week morning three st ambrose acquaintance have mustered with rest for anxious day work after such breakfast a have be able to eat under jesting remark that fool can ask in five minute more question than wise man can answer in week wish that examiner must play fair change side of table for hour with candidate for finish too though doe on sly be cramming with coach at available spare moment hardy have finished reading full thirty six hour before first day of paper work have braced for actual struggle by two good night rest long day on river with tom have worked hard from first so have really mastered book now feeling that have fairly honestly done best that if fails will be either from bad luck natural incapacity not from own fault manages to keep cooler head than of companion in trouble week paper work passed off uneventfully then come viva voce work for candidate for honor go in in alphabetical order four day for one more day work hardest of then there be nothing more to do wait patiently for class list on day there be good attendance in enclosed space to public be admitted front seat be often occupied by private climax have come be a though flood of misrule have at last broken bank overflowed whole college for two hour wine party in blake large ground floor room be kept up with wild reckless mirth in keeping with host temper blake be on mettle have asked man with whom have speaking acquaintance a if wished to face out disaster at once to whole world many of men came feeling uncomfortable must sooner have stayed away treated pluck a real misfortune after blake be best judge of how liked to be treated if have fancy for giving great wine on occasion civilest thing to do be to get to so went wondered a much a must desire at brilliant coolness of host speculating doubting nevertheless in own secret heart whether be acting after acting be doubt not worth doing acting be one must make allowance two men for mean getting up again directly having turn at blake drank freely urged guest to drink be superfluous courtesy for most part many of men left room considerably excited have dispersed for hour so to billiards stroll in town at ten o'clock reassembled at supper party of there be several in college evening especially monster one at chanter room champagne supper a have carefully ostentatiously announced on card of invitation flaunting champagne in face have be resented by drysdale others who drank champagne in tumbler then abused clamored for beer in middle of supper chanter whose prodigality in way be only exceeded by general meanness have lost temper at demand insisted that if wanted beer might send for for must pay for protest be treated with uproarious contempt gallon of ale soon made appearance in college jug tankard table be cleared song most of of more than doubtful character cigar sort of compounded drink from claret cup to egg flip succeeded company recruited constantly a men came into college be getting more more excited minute scout cleared away carried off relic of supper then left still revel went on till by midnight men be ripe for mischief folly among who retained brain at must suggest signal for breaking up be given by host falling from seat of men rose with shout to put to bed accomplished with difficulty after dropping several time left to snore off effect of debauch with one of boot on others took to doing what mischief occurred to in room one man mounted on chair with cigar in mouth have gone out be employed in pouring content of time piece unluckily maker not anticipating sort of test to work must be subjected have ingeniously left hole for winding up in top of clock so unusual facility existed for drowning world carrier be colored top to discovered in dressing room certainly a remarked chanter must have possible use for so many dress boot at once be pity beer must be wasted on whole perhaps material be never meant for combination have better have be kept apart others have gone away to break into kitchen headed by one who have just come into college vowed must have supper others to screw up unpopular tutor to break into room of inoffensive freshman remainder mustered on grass in quadrangle began playing leap frog larking one amongst last be hero who have be at blake wine one of quieter supper party though not so far gone a most of companion be by mean in state in must have cared to meet dean lent hearty aid accordingly to swell noise tumult be becoming something out of way even for st ambrose a leap frog be flagging drysdale suddenly appeared carrying silver plate be used on solemn occasion in common room allowed to be issued on special application for gentleman commoner party rush be made towards halloa here drysdale with lot of swag shouted one be going to do with cried drysdale paused moment with peculiarly sapient look of tipsy man who have suddenly lost thread of idea then suddenly broke out with to distant chorus great noise in men room to fair amount of shouting skylarking in quadrangle be long suffering men not given to interfering there must be end to endurance state of thing have arrived must no longer be met by turn in bed growl at uproar folly of undergraduate presently of rioter on grass caught sight of figure gliding along side quadrangle towards dean staircase shout arose that enemy be up little heed be paid to by greater number then figure passed from dean staircase to porter lodge of men who have sense left saw that be time to quit after warning rest went off towards room looking up what deuce do mean be such as dean will be out in minute get up come along tell old fellow said drysdale somewhat inarticulately driving knife into ground again don be going to spout college plate so be burying article for poshterity hang posterity said tom come along directly will be caught rusticated go to bed brown be drunk brown replied drysdale continuing work striking carving knife into ground so close to own thigh that made tom shudder here be then cried next moment seizing drysdale by arm a rush of men came through passage into quadrangle shouting tumbling along making in small group for different stair case dean two of tutor followed porter bearing lantern there be time to be lost so tom after one more struggle to pull drysdale up hurry off gave up leaving to fate ran across to own staircase for next half hour dean party patrolled college succeeded at last in restoring order though not without undignified disagreeable passage light on staircase generally burnt night be of course put out a approached on first staircase stormed porter lantern be knocked out of hand by unseen adversary light put out on bottom stair on first landing bursar trod on small terrier belonging to fast freshman dog naturally thereupon bit bursar leg while master other enfants perdus taking advantage of diversion rushed down dark stair past party of order into quadrangle where scattered amidst shout of laughter while porter be gone for light dean party rashly ventured on second ascent here unexpected catastrophy awaited on top landing lived one of steadiest men in college whose door have be tried shortly before have be roused out of first sleep vowing vengeance on next comer stood behind oak holding brown george huge earthenware receptacle half full of dirty water in bed maker have be washing up tea thing hearing stealthy step whispering on stair below suddenly threw open oak discharging whole content of brown george on approaching authority with appeared again with light continuing round apprehended disarmed drysdale collected college plate marked down others of rioter visited chanter room held parley with one of number who be screwed up in eight mile of very indifferent chalky road over down separate vale of kennet from vale of white horse mr brown be early man careful of horse who responded to care by being always well up to much more work than be ever put to drive to barton manor back in day be rare event in life master taking fact into consideration be bent on giving plenty of time for return journey have ordered groom to be ready to start by eight o'clock that might not disturb rest by early departure have sent carriage to village inn instead of to porter stable at appointed time therefore when evening amusement be just beginning at manor house mr brown sought out wife after few word of leave taking to host hostess two slipped quietly away walked down village carriage be standing before inn ready for with hostler mr night air chapter xxxii crisis in forenoon of following day tom rode slowly along street of englebourn towards rectory gate have left barton soon after breakfast without having be able to exchange word with mary except in presence of mother yet have felt more anxious than ever before at least to say good bye to without witness with view have be up early have whistled tune in hall held loud encouraging idea mr porter reminded neddy charley that have only ten day more have not yet looked at work have to do for tutor in holiday immediately after breakfast mr porter have wished good bye very kindly must not help thinking without air of near relationship have flattered be well established between member of porter family then have added now mary must say good bye want to come help of picking nosegay sending to by one of boy came into head gathered flower then thought better of threw away what right after have to be sending flower to above flower to have attached meaning to put on how to play for cannon did in patronizing way hand be unsteady nerve bad tom good eye steady hand practice have have at st ambrose pool table gave considerable advantage in hazard so played on mr wurley condescending to bet only crown game at first giving ten point then five at latter odds tom managed to be two game ahead when butler announced lunch at two o'clock think must order horse said tom putting on coat curse must give revenge be always five point better after lunch after dinner must give fifteen point why must stop dine sleep expect men to dinner thank must get home to day must like to taste mutton never kill five year old get day tom however be proof against mutton consented to stay till towards hour when other guest be expected finding that host have decided objection to be left alone so after lunch at mr wurley drank better part of bottle of old sherry to steady nerve returned again to billiards hudson regalia played on for hour though mr wurley hand be certainly steadier luck remained with tom be now getting rather tired of playing wanted to be leaving began to remember object of visit again mr wurley be nettled at being beaten by boy a counted opponent must hear of leaving off so tom played on carelessly game after game be soon again only two game ahead mr wurley temper be recovering tom protested that must go just one game more host urged tom consented must play for sovereign so played double quits after sharp struggle mr wurley won game at be highly elated talked again grandly of odds must give after dinner tom felt that be now never so a put on coat said well be much obliged to for very pleasant day mr wurley hope will come over again stay sleep will always be glad to see be so cursed hard to keep somebody always going in country thank must through extravagant form of worship not necessary to be specified put away must ever come right made solitary tea sat down again to consider point point must not be considered alone began to feel more on suit be helping on own whether helped on own not be after not that be uppermost in thought be much changed in respect since last sat in room just after first day with since then angel have met have touched cord of self trembling be passing in music out of sight thought of harry trial enabled to indulge in good honest indignation for there be room in own case that prospect in life of such man must be in power to great extent of such people a squire wurley farmer tester because happened to be poor must be turned out of cottage where family have lived for hundred year at week notice through caprice of drunken gambler because have stood up for right have thereby offended worst farmer in parish must be marked man unable to get work thing appeared so monstrous to tom made so angry that be obliged to get up stamp about room from particular case very soon got to generalization question have before now puzzled gained new significance minute became real to why few men must be rich rest poor above why must be one of few why mere possession of property must give man power over neighbor why poor men who be ready willing to work must only be allowed to work a sort of favor must after get merest tithe of what labor produced be tossed aside a soon a work be done longer required other such problem rose up before crude sharp asking to be solved feeling quite unable to give one answer to viz that be getting out of depth that whole business be in muddle have recourse to old method when in difficulty putting on cap started off to hardy room to talk matter over see whether must not get light on from quarter returned in hour so somewhat le troubled in mind inasmuch a have found friend in pretty much same state of mind on such topic a one step have gained under arm carried certain book from hardy scanty library perusal of hoped at least might enable sooner later to feel that have got on to sort of firm ground at rate hardy have advised to read so without more ado drew chair to table began to look into glimpse of manner in tom spent first evening of second year at oxford will enable intelligent reader to understand why though took to reading far more kindly honestly than have ever done before made great advance in proper study of place not that wholly neglected for hardy kept pretty well up to collar passed little go creditably be fairly placed at college examination in of book have to get up for lecture be genuinely interested politics of athens struggle between roman pleb patrician mon sacer agrarian law began to have new meaning to chiefly because bore more le on great harry winburn problem problem indeed for have now fairly swelled into condition of england problem be becoming day more more urgent importunate shaking many old belief leading knew not very matter of leading be sore trial to further got on new road more felt want of guidance guidance of man for of book soon found to be bewildering college tutor whom consulted only deprecated waste of tune on finding impossible to dissuade at last recommended economic work of day a proper well spring of truth on such matter to tom accordingly went read with docility faith of youth bent on learning feeling in presence of men who have assumed right of speaking with authority spoke to with authority read on believing much hoping more somehow did not really satisfy though silenced for time be not fault of book most of laid down clearly enough that what professed to teach be science of man material interest law of making employment of capital escaped in eagerness wandered up down page in search of quite science of law with did not meddle nevertheless here there seemed to touch upon what be in search of be much fascinated for instance by doctrine of greatest happiness of greatest number for sake swallowed for time though not without wry face dogma self interest be true pivot of social action population have perpetual tendency to outstrip mean of living to establish preventive check on population be duty of good citizen so lived on for time in dreary uncomfortable state fearing for future of country with little hope about own when came to take stock of newly acquired knowledge to weigh measure found to consist of sort of hazy conviction that society must be right ready for millennium when man must do what liked nobody must interfere with there must be law against marriage result be more than must stand roused shook began to think well present teacher be very clever men well meaning men too see if teaching be only to land here why be scarcely worth while going through
