have duelling be in fashion still in england must probably have fought in quiet corner of park before night a be only said bitter thing parted agreeing not to know one in future three day afterwards at petty session where tom brought upon severe censure of bench for conduct on trial harry winburn be committed to reading gaol for three month reader who will take trouble to remember picture of hero mental growth during past year attempted to be given in late chapter state of restless dissatisfaction into experience thought reading have thrown by time long vacation have come around again will perhaps be prepared for catastrophe ensued on conviction sentence of harry winburn at petty session hitherto notwithstanding strength of new revolutionary force be mustering round there have always be citadel holding out in mind garrisoned by be best in toryism in have be brought up by loyalty reverence for established order established institution by family tradition pride of inherited good name now wall of citadel went down with crash garrison being put to sword making away to hide in out of way corner wait for reaction be much easier for youngster whose attention be once turned to such subject a have be occupying tom to get hold of wild violent belief notion in day than now state of europe generally be far more dead hopeless there be war certainly expectation of war there be dull beaten down pent up feeling abroad a if lid be screwed down on nation thing have be however cruel heavy mean be that be to remain to end england be better off than neighbour yet in bad case in south west particularly several cause have combined to spread very bitter feeling abroad amongst agricultural poor first among stood new poor law provision of be vigorously carried out in most district poor have a yet felt harshness only of new system then land be in many place in hand of men on last leg old sporting farmer who have begun business a young men while great war be going on have made money hand over hand for few year out of war price have tried to go on living with greyhound yeomanry uniform horse to ride weapon to wear through hard year have followed be bad master way unthrifty profligate needy narrow minded younger men who be supplanting be introducing machinery threshing machine winnowing machine to take little bread poor man be still able to earn out of mouth of wife child so at least poor thought muttered to one muttering broke out now then in long night of winter month in blazing rick broken machine game preserving be on increase australia america have not yet become familiar word in english village labour market be everywhere overstocked last not least corn law be still in force bitter exasperating strife in went out be at height while swing myrmidon be abroad in county must scarcely be kept down by yeomanry poor law guardian great town be in almost worse case here too emigration have not set in to thin labour market wage be falling price rising corn law struggle be better understood far keener than in country chartism be gaining force day rising into huge threatening giant waiting to put forth strength eager for occasion seemed at hand generation of young englishman who be too young then to be troubled with such matter have grown into manhood since little know may never know what be to be living citizen of divided distracted nation for time that danger be past in happy home so far a man can judge in time only just in time came repeal of corn law great cause of strife sense of injustice passed away out of men mind nation be roused by irish famine fearful distress in other part of country to begin looking steadily seriously at of sore be festering in body undermining health life so tide have turned england have already passed critical point when came upon christendom whole of europe leapt up into wild blaze of revolution be anyone still inclined to make light of danger threatened england in year to sneer at th of april monster petition monster meeting on kennington other common well if there be such person among reader can only say that can have known nothing of what be going on around below at time earnestly hope amongst to take little cloud in hand in time make descend in soft rain such matter need not be spoken of here want to do be to put young reader in position to understand how be that hero fell away against attempt at repose have scarcely time to produce cheroot from case light under many difficulty when horse must begin fidgeting pulling at bridle shifting round to get tail to wind clearly did just a came to last gun larry be captain servant be trying by to turn one of round so a to fire on enemy a took river to back of line in huddle so turned to lend hand when looked round next moment time will get on with a can in time for next mail since beginning letter have have relapse so in case must never finish will say at once what most want to say winburn have saved life more than once be chapter xlvi from india to englebourn if knowledge of contemporary history must be reckoned a important element in civilization of people then be afraid that good folk of englebourn must have be producer of corn other grain careful stolid nurse guardian of youthful ox sheep pig many of far better fed housed than own child penetrating a be one can not help wondering that did not give up most dozen weekly paper london journal sound in church state principle most respectable not otherwise than heavy came saturday to rectory conservative county paper be taken in at red lion david constable blacksmith clubbed together to purchase liberal paper by help of managed to wage unequal war with knot of village quidnunc who assembled almost nightly at bar of tory beast above referred to king of beast red indeed in colour of truest blue in political principle besides perhaps three four more paper be taken by farmer scanty a food be be quite enough for mouth indeed when paper once how be likely to be englebourn be situated on trunk road amount of intercourse between rest of world be of most limited kind rector never left home curate at rare interval most of farmer went to alley of small public house in nearest town while horse rested with above exception probably not one of villager strayed ten mile from home from year end to year end a to visitor occasional peddler so captain abettor having gained constable a ally prevailed englebourn much wondering at made ready for general holiday chapter xlvii wedding day one more poor man un done one more poor man un done belfry tower rocked reeled a peal rang out now merry now scornful now plaintive from whose narrow belfry window into bosom of soft south west wind be playing round old grey tower of englebourn church wind caught peal played with bore away over rectory village street many homestead gently waving field of ripening corn rich pasture water meadow tall whispering wood of grange rolled against hill side up slope past clump of fir on hawk lynch till died away on wild stretch of common beyond ringer bent lustily to work there have be no such ringing in englebourn since end of great war not content with usual peal out of church came back again again in afternoon full of good cheer have be provided for again again wedding peal rang out from belfry in honour of old comrade one more poor man un done one more poor man un done such be ungallant speech for many generation have be attributed to englebourn wedding bell when have once caught word a must be sure to do from wide mouthed grinning boy lounging over churchyard rail to see wedding pas must be impossible to persuade that did in fact say anything else somehow harry winburn bore undoing in most heroic manner did duty throughout trying day a non commissioned groom must only part of performance arranged by captain fairly resisted be proposed departure of patty to solitary post chaise of englebourn real old yellow with pair of horse east after hearing sergeant pleading on subject of vehicle at last allowed to drive off in tax cart taking small boy with behind to bring back a for festivity went off without hitch a such affair will where leader of revel have heart in child have played romped eaten drunk into state of torpor by early hour of evening farmer dinner be decided success east proposed health of bride bridegroom be followed by farmer grove constable david turned out in new blue swallow tailed coat with metal button of own fabulous cut in honor of occasion farmer spoke like leader of government opposition in house of common on address to crown there be not pin to choose between speech stranger hearing must naturally have concluded that harry have never be anything model boy young man of parish fortunately oratorical power of englebourn ended here east majority of guest adjourned to green where cricket be in progress game lasted very short time only a youth of englebourn be not expert in noble science lost wicket one after so fast that tom hardy have time to play out two match with then to retire on laurel while afternoon be yet young old folk in village school room enjoyed beef pudding under special superintendence of miss winter then toddled to home sat about in warmest nook must find mumbling of old time doings at dr winter wedding david devoted to superintending issue of beer swelling with importance so full of milk of human kindness from great event of day that nobody minded little air did duty so satisfactorily that with exception of one two regular confirmed soaker who stuck steadily to tap of red lion there managed successfully to fuddle there be nothing like drunkenness in short be one of rare day when everything go right everybody seems to be inclined to give take to make allowance for neighbour by degree cricket flagged most of men went off to sit over pipe finish evening in own way boy girl took to playing at kissing in ring child who have not already gone home sat in group watching miss winter have already disappeared tom hardy captain began to feel that might consider part finished strolled together off green towards hardy lodging red lion being still in possession of east guest well how do think went off asked nothing must have be better said hardy seem so inclined to be reasonable that think will even have roaring song along street to night when red lion shuts up be satisfied tom must think so have be hoping for day time four year now have come gone off well too thanks to harry thanks to very good be open to amount of gratitude think have reason xlviii beginning of end from englebourn festivity tom east returned to london captain be bent on starting for possession in south pacific a regained strength energized over preparation went about in cab purchasing agricultural implement sometimes by light of nature sometimes under guidance of harry winburn invested also in something of library in large quantity of saddlery in short package of kind began to increase multiply upon then there be selecting of vessel negotiation with ship captain a to term business of getting introduced to conferring with people from colony who be supposed to know something about altogether east have plenty of work on hand more have to do better more cheery became tom on contrary be rather lower than usual half formed hope that good luck be going to happen to after patty marriage be beginning to grow faint contrast of friend definite present purpose in life with own uncertainty made more le melancholy in spite of effort father have offered tour abroad now that have finished with oxford urging that seemed to want change to freshen up before buckling to profession that must never in likelihood have such chance must not make up mind to accept offer attraction to london be too strong for though saw little hope of anything happening to improve prospect must not keep away from spent most of time when not with east in haunting neighborhood of mr porter house in belgravia place where be likely to catch distant glimpse of mary avoiding chance of actual meeting recognition from shrank in present frame of mind nearest approach to flame allowed be renewal of old friendship with grey who be still working on in westminister rookery have become great favorite with mr porter who be always trying to get to house to feed properly be much astonished sometimes almost provoked at small success of hospitable endeavor grey be so taken up with own pursuit that did not occur to to be surprised that never met tom at house of relation be innocent of knowledge suspicion of real state of thing so tom must talk to with perfect freedom about uncle household picking up such scrap of information a grey possessed without compromising feeling shy thus woolsack by offer of place on board yacht cruise to norway have fortunately lent join company with hero again on fine july morning reader will begin to think at rate be always blessed with fine weather trouble may have to endure if be not to have fine weather in novel when where be to have be fine july morning then street be already beginning to feel sultry a worked way westward grey who nine mile to north west of london who took great interest in grey doings have asked to bring child of night school down to spend day in ground be happy occasion be before day of cheap excursion by
